intro: Ceropegia parvianthera, commonly known as the small-angled ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces delicate, tubular flowers that are often pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
